content.title: Frydenberg、住宅暴動に直面 - オーストラリア人
content.desc: Josh Frydenberg has accused Bill Shorten of being “shifty and confused” after the Opposition Leader revealed Labor was unsure of the start date for its negative gearing reforms, as the Treasurer faces a states’ revolt over national housing market regulations amid the housing market slide. West Australian Treasurer Ben Wyatt yesterday called on the ­nation’s banking regulator, the Australian Prudential Regulation Authority, to take regional conditions into account after the ­Reserve Bank indicated it could be forced to cut official interest rates. The plea came after RBA deputy governor Guy ...

content.title: 金融監督当局はIOOFの取締役および経営幹部を失格とする -  The Guardian
content.desc: The financial regulator is seeking to disqualify the directors and senior executives of one of Australia’s biggest wealth managers, IOOF Investment Management, for failing to act in the best interests of superannuation members. The startling move on Friday – which prompted the firm’s shares to crash 36% – comes after the IOOF managing director, Chris Kelaher, gave shocking evidence to the banking royal commission in August about its treatment of super members. At one point, Kelaher defended IOOF’s decision to compensate investors in a cash management trust, using their own money, for a mist...

content.title: APRAがトップ・エグゼクティブを失格に移したため、100億ドルが跳ね上がる -  ABC News
content.desc: Australia's financial regulator has taken action against superannuation giant IOOF in the Federal Court and is trying to disqualify its top executives from managing people's retirement savings. Its managing director Chris Kelaher, along with four senior executives, failed to act in the best interests of superannuation members, the Australian Prudential Regulation Authority (APRA) alleges. This led to IOOF's share price plunging 31.7 per cent to $4.90 at 11:45am (AEDT), its lowest value in 18 years. In dollar terms, $800 million was wiped off the company's market value in just a few hours. I...

content.title: 規制当局がトップ・エグゼクティブをターゲットにしているため、オーストラリアのIOOFは28％低下 -  Financial Times
content.source_nm: ファイナンシャルタイムズ
content.desc: Australia’s banking regulator said on Friday it is seeking to disqualify five senior executives and directors of IOOF Holdings, including the wealth managers’ managing director and chairman, for failing to act in the best interests of pension fund members. The legal action initiated by the Australian Prudential Regulatory Authority (Apra) caused a sharp sell off in IOOF shares, which were down by 28 per cent to A$5.15 ($3.72) about an hour after opening on the ASX. ANZ Bank, which is selling part of its wealth division to IOOF for A$1bn, said it was assessing its “options” following Apra’s ...

content.title: プライバシー侵害の可能性があるCBA顧客の医療データ -  ABCニュース
content.desc: By Dan Oakes The Commonwealth Bank is urgently investigating a potential data breach that may have given its staff access to customers' sensitive medical information. The issue was discovered around late July as the bank made preparations for the $3.8 billion sale of its insurance arm, CommInsure, to the AIA group. Medical information supplied by an unknown number of customers to CommInsure was made available to other arms of the bank, including to staff who decide whether to approve or decline loan applications. The bank said since the discovery of the potential breach, it had been scourin...
